Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Intern Librarians Edmonton , AB Description This posting is for two temporary positions until May 2025.
The Edmonton Public Library is looking for two highly motivated librarians to join our team as our 2024/25 Intern Librarians. This Internship opportunity is a chance to show that you have the right stuff to contribute to a dynamic organization. We are looking for a librarian who is passionate about reducing barriers to accessing library services and providing an exceptional customer experience.
Collections and Spaces – Intern Librarian
Under the direction of the Executive Director, Customer Experience, the Collections and Spaces Intern Librarian will employ research, evaluation, and assessment to conduct an in-depth review of spaces with a focus on collection use to understand and assess how customers are using library material to inform recommendations to improve the customer experience. The intern will analyze EPL’s public spaces and how their use impact collection usage through observational studies, journey mapping, analysis of circulation data, in-house use data, comparative analysis of borrowing patterns, customer interviews, etc. The research undertaken by the Collections and Spaces Intern Librarian will inform future direction for EPL’s branch refresh and space planning initiatives, physical layout, shelving, display, and circulation practices.
Researcher – Intern Librarian
Under the direction of the Executive Director, Collections, Marketing, and Technology, the Research Intern will conduct literature reviews, environmental scans, and surveys on a variety of topics. The Intern will closely support EPL’s senior leadership and other key individuals by conducting staff and customer surveys to understand how the concept of convivencia* can be woven into EPL’s public spaces and services. Additionally, the Intern will conduct a comprehensive literature review and environmental scan on the subject of digital literacy to support the evolution of EPL’s digital literacy services and programs.
* Convivencia is a Latin American concept for a cooperative state between harmony and open conflict, which emphasizes practice, effort, negotiation, and accommodation. To strive for convivencia is approaching public life as a dance, an active and constant negotiation where a diverse set of actors learns over time to share public goods and spaces but where mistakes and friction are an inevitable part of public life.
Qualifications:
You must have successfully completed a Master of Library and Information Studies (MLIS) program by May 1, 2024 and have graduated within the last two years. Candidates with older MLIS graduation dates will not be considered. Essential skills needed for these positions includes: Experience in research methods and design of research projects; High level of initiative and independence; Ability to define and manage a multi-faceted complex project while meeting timelines and quality standards Demonstrated passion for and experience in service to library customers is preferred; Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; Strong customer service orientation; Superb organizational and time management skills; Strong skills and demonstrated aptitude in desktop computing, use of web tools, and library technologies; Ability to collaborate effectively and to contribute as a member of the Library Services Team; Imagination, creativity, and risk taking are key skills; Professional commitment to the CFLA Position Statements on Intellectual Freedom and on Diversity and Inclusion is essential. Note: You must have the ability to travel within the City of Edmonton. Hours of Work: 35 hours per week Pay Band: $38.56 - $49.22 per hour* *Approximately $70,463 - $89,930 per annum based on a 35 hour work week. Shift differential may apply in accordance with the terms and conditions of the CSU 52 Collective Agreement.
To apply: Submit a current resume with two references (one professional/instructor, one direct supervisor) and cover letter indicating how you qualify for this opportunity, how you will make a difference to EPL and the community, and how this position will help you achieve your future library career objectives. Please visit www.epl.ca/careers and apply online. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Chief Librarian Sparwood , BC Description CHIEF LIBRARIAN The Sparwood Public Library is a facility, which first established its operations in March12 1975. The library has a modern facility and is a beloved part of the community. Location: Sparwood, BC Reports to: Library Board General Accountability: The Chief Librarian organizes and directs all areas of library operations and provides vision and leadership to all aspects of the library in accordance with the Library Act of British Columbia and the established Policies and Procedures of the Sparwood t Public Library Board. The Chief Librarian makes recommendations and presents reports to the Board; manages staff; sets standards for collection development and programming; and promotes and represents the Library in the community, regionally, provincially, nationally and to other appropriate organizations. Specific Responsibilities: To the Board
• Act as secretary to the Board • Prepare meeting Agendas with Board Chair • Deliver agendas, minutes, financial and other reports, and communicates in a timely manner • Provide a written Library Director’s report for Board meetings and any other required reports to keep Board informed of current library activities • Notify the Board of any maintenance, security or repair problems. Recommend solutions. Review policies annually and present revisions to Board for approval • Interview and screen staff for library positions • Determine community needs for library services and recommend changes or improvements to the Board • Engage in strategic planning and community surveys with the direction of the Board • Assist Treasurer in preparing the annual budget for Board approval • Assist Treasurer in completion/submission of SOFI • Recommend, plan and implement fund raising activities as required
• Research and apply for grants to improve library services • Attend community meetings as required to promote or protect library services • Other related duties as agreed between the Board and the Library Director Supervisory Responsibilities • Direct staff and volunteers. • Interview and screen volunteers for vacant positions. • Ensure criminal records checks are completed and up to date for all staff and facilitators. Maintain staff/facilitator files. • Provide information on safety and library security. Correct unsafe practices as they arise. • Maintain procedure manual for staff to ensure high level of library service in the absence of the Library Director • Maintain procedure manual for volunteers
• Communicate changes to policies and procedures • Direct and evaluate job performance for staff as per policy. File reports. • Supervise scheduling of staff and volunteers • Ensure that staff read minutes from Board meetings to stay informed • Address problems with staff, volunteers, Board members and patrons immediately using sound problem solving techniques.
• sound problem solving techniques • Maintain an ‘incident book’ documenting incidents for review and action of Board if unable to resolve directly • Help recruit Board members, volunteers, and staff Administrative Responsibilities • Implement strategic plans and provide a quarterly report to Board. • Update, implement, and evaluate procedure manuals and approved policies • Manage online catalogue data and library website • Promote Sparwood library programs and services (articles, brochures, posters, website and Facebook) • Handle correspondence and filing
• Maintain communication/memberships with Libraries Branch (LB), Association of BC Public Library Directors (ABCPLD), British Columbia Library Association (BCLA), British Columbia Library Trustee Association (BCLTA), Kootenay Library Federation (KLF), SITKA • Keep informed of the BC Library Act, FOIPPA, Employment Standards Act and provincial initiatives related to libraries • Work with other agencies to promote the library and offer services. • Oversee granted projects; complete final reports • Administer approved staff hours in budget • Collect statistics (circulation, volunteer hours, public computer use, etc) • Complete/submit Annual Statistics and Grant reports to the Libraries Branch • Generate reports. Analyze statistics. Determine trends • Study BC library statistics to maintain/improve Sparwood Public Library
standards.
• Complete an inventory of library items every 2 years. • Update and maintain inventory of furniture and equipment. Store a copy off site for security purposes • Order office/library/janitorial supplies and equipment
• Arrange for repairs/maintenance of technical equipment, photocopier, plumbing, etc. to minimize disruption of library services; • Perform monthly computer back-ups and store off-site. Update computer logbook to maintain communication with technical support. Financial Responsibilities • Conduct all financial and budgetary activities of the library in accordance with Board Polices and Procedures and Purchasing Guidelines • Administer approved budget with the guidance of the Treasurer. Manage money transfers and credit card account. File receipts for monthly bookkeeping. Reconcile petty cash as needed. • Work with Treasurer to keep terms up to date • Report possible budget shortfalls to the Treasurer/Board in a timely manner • Record hours worked for all employees and casual staff (specifying project type if
different from regular wages) on a calendar for each pay period • Submit a payroll report to bookkeeper and issue paychecks • Pay bills and keep accurate records of all expenditures. • Keep accurate records of daily cash transactions: fines and fees, book sales, donations and sponsorships. Make deposits. Balance cash float. • Issue tax receipts for donations and book/magazine sponsorships • Track and record usage of donations that specify use • Keep accurate records of other revenue (grants, etc.) and manage spending • Post financials and deliver all paperwork to the bookkeeper for each month -end.
